sub_title: HSSE Lead  / Technical Safety Engineer: Integrated Gas Projects
summary:
A Chartered Process Engineer and Technical Authority (Shell) with over 18 years’ experience in the oil and gas industry. Multiple roles held both in Operations and in Process Design through all phases of projects. Over 6 years’ experience with an international O&G consultancy in Aberdeen, Scotland, supporting Flow Assurance feasibility studies for Green and Brownfield subsea tie-back studies for major clients; ExxonMobil, BP, Shell, BG Norway and BG Tunisia. 

Experienced Technical Safety engineer; Participation and Facilitation of multiple HAZOP / HAZID / Bowtie Reviews. Contract management for 3rd Party Technical Safety Consultancies for studies during Concept Select, FEED and Detailed Design phases of major projects.

Lead Process / Technical Safety Engineer (Shell Resident Team) for a major LNG Expansion Project ($12 Bln - Estimate) with Sakhalin Energy (Russia), a Shell JV company.

Additional experience includes working for major operators  (ExxonMobil / Shell / BP) and for an international O&G consultancy over 7 years. Project locations include UK North Sea, Russia & Tunisia. Operational experience - 2 years at Fawley Refinery (ExxonMobil), UK. 

Independent Process Engineer for the HAZOP studies of the Triton FPSO (HESS) Complete Topsides & Claymore Platform Compression Upgrade Project.

profile_positions.description:
Salym Petroleum Development (SPD) is a joint venture between Shell (50%) and Gazpromneft (50%). The Head Office is in Moscow; field operations are located in the Salym Area of West Siberia.

Concept design engineer for infrastructure projects to increase production and water injection capacity to achieve increasing forecasts. Flow assurance studies to develop strategy for transportation of highly viscous crude over long distances. Liaise with Shell Global Solutions FA Technical Authorities to develop optimised viscous emulsions management strategy. Develop concept options for Decision Review Board review for a major capital investment project.

Organisation and Facilitation of HAZOP and HAZID studies. Project Framing Session facilitator.

Support annual Work Program and Budget Proposal Development activities - Techno-Economic proposals of production capacity increase concept designs.

Working location: Moscow and Tyumen, Western Siberia.
profile_positions.title: Concept Design / Technical Safety Engineer

profile_positions.description:
7 years experience with Wood Group Frontier O&G Consultancy: Multiple on and offshore based feasibility studies (Concept Select) for major oil companies.

Involved in conceptual design studies (Process and Flow Assurance) for facilities in the North Sea and overseas (Russia, Tunisia).

Projects include; Process Engineering support for Conceptual/FEED, and detailed design activities, Flow Assurance support for numerous multiple subsea tie-backs (brown and green field) to either fixed platforms or FPSOs (e.g. BP Devenick / BG Knarr). Thistle Alpha Platform Process Simplification (ENQUEST), Montrose Platform (Talisman): Produced Water System Upgrade. •	Forties Charlie (Apache): Fuel Gas Skid Commissioning

One year (2007/8) based in Moscow for the Conceptual and FEED studies of a greenfield gas and liquids processing plant in Central Russia for TNK-BP.

One month in Tunisia with BG Tunisia commissioning a liquified butane and propane transfer system (2x130km buried pipelines). I was also part of the original conceptual and detailed design team.

Independent Process Engineer: Triton FPSO (HESS) Complete Topsides HAZOP / Claymore Platform New Gas Compression Train Module HAZOP (Talisman)

Assistant Interviewer for IChemE Chartership Interviews

Member of the Aberdeen IChemE Committee
